page.title: 17Shopping
page.content: People from our area do their main shopping in Wellington, Telford, Shrewsbury, Much_Wenlock and Bridgnorth. Our survey showed that 68% of local people shop at Shrewsbury, 11% at Telford, 9% at Wellington, 6% go to Much_Wenlock but only 1% go to Bridgnorth. Shrewsbury and Telford have big super_markets which are cheaper than a small local shop where we might buy single items. Here are some current prices: an 800g loaf of bread costs about 40p, milk is about 23p pt. A litre bottle of orange squash costs around 49p, 1kg of sugar costs around 48p, a can of coke 17p, a dozen small eggs about 65p, 500g of butter 47p and 1 pound of cheese would be about Â£1.20.
